name: Belhurst - Chambers in the Castle

reviews.title: GLORIFIED HAMPTON INN
reviews.text: After spending a week traveling different areas of New York Wine Country, my wife and I were looking forward to staying at Belhurst Castle, due to the castle being booked we made reservations to stay in the new part of the castle, we thought wow its new this will be great. IT WASNT GREAT!!!

reviews.title: Had a Wonderful Time at Belhurst
reviews.text: We had the worst check in experience ever, it was something out of a movie it was so bad. We were very disapointed upon entering our guest room. Yes it is new, and clean and fresh, but there is no character at all, my wife commented it was like staying at a very expensive Hampton Inn, without the swimming pool. After about ten minutes in the room we heard a very loud noise and realized it was the plumbing from the neighboring room, needless to say at that point we called the inn we had spent the two previous nights in over on Cayuga lake and found that our room was still available, we quickly grabbed our bags, and headed back to the other Inn. We didnt even argue with the front desk staff, we said charge us for the night, not even stopping to sample the wine. Good luck working out the kinks in the first year. We do not plan on returning.

reviews.title: Wow!!
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a couple of days at Belhurst Castle with another couple. After reading some of the reviews here I thought I might have made a bad decision going there, but we were pleasently surprised. The staff was friendly and helpful, the accomodations and food was good (the breakfast buffett was a little cold), and the free flowing wine faucet kept us in a good mood. We will probably go back again someday.

reviews.title: Excellent overall- no complaints. Staff cooperative and pleasant.
reviews.text: The castle was a fine place. The room was spacious. It had an excellent view of Lake Seneca. The bed was comfortable. The gas fireplace and jacuzzi were a charming touch.

reviews.title: Mixed
reviews.text: Stayed two nights. First night we stayed in the Tower suite. A little pricey but worth it. Second night we stayed in the Garrett room. It was like going from the penthouse to the outhouse. Tiny room, AC barely worked, bed squeeked. Avoid this room. Service was good. Had dinner onsite at Edgar's. We ordered shrimp and pasta dishes that were extremely bland. Once again service was good. Overall it was good.

reviews.title: Horrible, loud castle
reviews.text: Stay away from loud, rude castle.

reviews.title: Embarrassing
reviews.text: Stayed at the new Vinifera Inn in August 2004. Plumbing was so loud next to us and above our room it woke us up twice and drove us out of the room early every day.

reviews.title: Nice place
reviews.text: Stayed two nights in the Vinifera wing of the Castle and it was very nice. It is more a hotel room than bed and breakfast atmosphere but the room was very spacious and the fireplace and jacuzzi were wonderful on a cool fall night. The grounds and the gorgeous view were worth the price. The breakfast buffet was ok -some of the food was cold and so were the plates but at $7.00 it isn't so overpriced. They do have a continental breakfast which they didn't tell us about - we stumbled upon it.

reviews.title: An enchanting fall getaway!
reviews.text: The staff was all very nice.

aka: Belhurst - Chambers In The Castle Hotel
description: On the shores of Seneca Lake in the heart of the Finger Lakes Wine Region, Belhurst takes you away to a place filled with history, beauty and breathtaking views. Visit our newest addition ~ Isabella Spa, open to the public and perfect for bridal parties. Belhurst also offers a winery and gift shop, 2 restaurants, 2 large ballrooms accommodating 250 people for weddings and 8 breakout rooms for corporate and business meeting space.
